meanings.definition: To deform or distort in shape.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally misshaped the clay into a lopsided figure.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind can misshape the tree branches over time.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to misshape the perfectly round ball into a square.
meanings.sent4: His negative comments can misshape her self-confidence.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly to misshape the soft clay into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The misshape of the rock made it difficult to fit into the wall.
meanings.sent2: The misshape of the cloud resembled a dragon in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The misshape of the cookie brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The misshape of the shadow on the wall looked like a dancing figure.
meanings.sent5: The misshape of the puzzle piece made it hard to find its place in the picture.
